title: The COVID-19 Pandemic and Caregiver Discrimination Under Federal Employment Discrimination Laws
description: The COVID-19 pandemic has significantly impacted employees' work and personal obligations, creating concurrent and, at times, competing job and caregiving demands. Abrupt changes in work locations, schedules, or employment status required millions of Americans with caregiving responsibilities for children, spouses, partners, older relatives, individuals with disabilities, or other individuals to quickly adjust to vastly changed circumstances.
